table.name: [dbo].[apogeeDesign]
table.summary: Contains the plate design information for APOGEE plates.
table.remarks: This table contains all the design parameters used in designing plates for APOGEE spectra.

column.name: [designid]
column.summary: Design ID from plate design (Primary key)

column.name: [ra]
column.summary: Right ascension, J2000, of plate center

column.name: [dec]
column.summary: Declination, J2000, of plate center

column.name: [location_id]
column.summary: Location ID (Foreign key)

column.name: [radius]
column.summary: Utilized radius of plate

column.name: [shared]
column.summary: If set to 1, a plate shared with another survey (0 if not)

column.name: [comments]
column.summary: Additional comments on design

column.name: [short_cohort_version]
column.summary: Which of this field's short cohorts is in this design

column.name: [medium_cohort_version]
column.summary: Which of this field's medium cohorts is in this design

column.name: [long_cohort_version]
column.summary: Which of this field's long cohorts is in this design

column.name: [number_of_short_fibers]
column.summary: Number of fibers alloted to short cohort targets

column.name: [number_of_medium_fibers]
column.summary: Number of fibers alloted to medium cohort targets

column.name: [number_of_long_fibers]
column.summary: Number of fibers alloted to long cohort targets

column.name: [short_cohort_min_h]
column.summary: Minimum H mag of short cohort

column.name: [short_cohort_max_h]
column.summary: Maximum H mag of short cohort

column.name: [medium_cohort_min_h]
column.summary: Minimum H mag of medium cohort

column.name: [medium_cohort_max_h]
column.summary: Maximum H mag of medium cohort

column.name: [long_cohort_min_h]
column.summary: Minimum H mag of long cohort

column.name: [long_cohort_max_h]
column.summary: Maximum H mag of long cohort

column.name: [dereddened_min_j_ks_color]
column.summary: Minimum (J-Ks)o for this design; -1 if no color cut applied

column.name: [number_of_visits]
column.summary: Total number of visits intended for this design

column.name: [number_of_tellurics]
column.summary: Number of hot star tellurics on this design (tellurics/science targets may overlap)

column.name: [number_of_sky]
column.summary: Number of sky targets on this design

column.name: [number_of_science]
column.summary: Number of science targets on this design (tellurics/science targets may overlap)

table.name: [dbo].[apogeeField]
table.summary: Contains the basic information for an APOGEE field.
table.remarks: This table contains the name, location and number of visits expected for an APOGEE field.

column.name: [field_name]
column.summary: Name of field

column.name: [location_id]
column.summary: Location ID (Primary key)

column.name: [ra]
column.summary: Right ascension of field center (J2000)

column.name: [dec]
column.summary: Declination of field center (J2000)

column.name: [expected_no_of_visits]
column.summary: Expected number of visits for this field (not necessarily the number of visits actually achieved)

table.name: [dbo].[apogeeObject]
table.summary: Contains the targeting information for an APOGEE object.
table.remarks: This table contains all the parameters that went into targeting objects for APOGEE spectra.

column.name: [apogee_id]
column.summary: ID identifying this target object

column.name: [target_id]
column.summary: Unique targeting ID identifying this target object (of form [location_id].[apogee_id])

column.name: [alt_id]
column.summary: Alternate name for non-2MASS objects

column.name: [location_id]
column.summary: Location ID

column.name: [ra]
column.summary: Right ascension (J2000)

column.name: [dec]
column.summary: Declination (J2000)

column.name: [j]
column.summary: 2MASS J-band magnitude

column.name: [j_err]
column.summary: 2MASS J-band magnitude error

column.name: [h]
column.summary: H-band magnitude

column.name: [src_h]
column.summary: Source of H magnitude

column.name: [h_err]
column.summary: H-band magnitude error

column.name: [k]
column.summary: 2MASS Ks-band magnitude

column.name: [k_err]
column.summary: 2MASS Ks-band magnitude error

column.name: [irac_3_6]
column.summary: IRAC 3.6 micron magnitude

column.name: [irac_3_6_err]
column.summary: IRAC 3.6 micron magnitude error

column.name: [irac_4_5]
column.summary: IRAC 4.5 micron magnitude

column.name: [irac_4_5_err]
column.summary: IRAC 4.5 micron magnitude error

column.name: [src_4_5]
column.summary: source of 4.5 micron magnitude used for targeting

column.name: [irac_5_8]
column.summary: IRAC 5.4 micron magnitude

column.name: [irac_5_8_err]
column.summary: IRAC 5.4 micron magnitude error

column.name: [irac_8_0]
column.summary: IRAC 8.0 micron magnitude

column.name: [irac_8_0_err]
column.summary: IRAC 8.0 micron magnitude error

column.name: [wise_4_5]
column.summary: WISE allWISE release 4.5 micron magnitude

column.name: [wise_4_5_err]
column.summary: WISE allWISE release 4.5 micron magnitude error

column.name: [ak_wise]
column.summary: Ks-band extinction based on WISE allWISE release photometry

column.name: [sfd_ebv]
column.summary: E(B-V) at object's position in Schlegel, Finkbeiner, & David (1998) maps

column.name: [wash_m]
column.summary: Washington M magnitude

column.name: [wash_m_err]
column.summary: Washington M magnitude error

column.name: [wash_t2]
column.summary: Washington T2 magnitude

column.name: [wash_t2_err]
column.summary: Washington T2 magnitude error

column.name: [DDO51]
column.summary: DDO51 magnitude

column.name: [DDO51_err]
column.summary: DDO51 magnitude error

column.name: [wash_ddo51_giant_flag]
column.summary: Luminosity class classification derived from Wash+DDO51 data (1 = giant, 0 = dwarf, -1 = no data)

column.name: [wash_ddo51_star_flag]
column.summary: Stellar classification based on Washington+DDO51 data (0=extended, 1=star-like or no data)

column.name: [targ_4_5]
column.summary: 4.5 micron magnitude used for targeting

column.name: [targ_4_5_err]
column.summary: Error in 4.5 micron magnitude used for targeting

column.name: [ak_targ]
column.summary: Ks-band extinction used for target selection

column.name: [ak_targ_method]
column.summary: Method to calculate Ks-band extinction used for target selection (RJCE_IRAC, RJCE_WISE_ALLSKY, RJCE_WISE_PARTSKY, RJCE_WISE_OPS2, RJCE_WISE_OPS, SFD_EBV, NONE)

column.name: [pmra]
column.summary: Proper motion in RA

column.name: [pmra_err]
column.summary: Uncertainty in proper motion in RA

column.name: [pmdec]
column.summary: Proper motion in Dec

column.name: [pmdec_err]
column.summary: Uncertainty in proper motion in Dec

column.name: [pm_src]
column.summary: Source of proper motion data

column.name: [tmass_a]
column.summary: Source of 2MASS optical counterpart

column.name: [tmass_pxpa]
column.summary: Position angle of 2MASS optical counterpart (East of North)

column.name: [tmass_prox]
column.summary: Proximity of 2MASS nearest neighbor

column.name: [tmass_phqual]
column.summary: 2MASS ph_qual flag

column.name: [tmass_rdflg]
column.summary: 2MASS read_flag

column.name: [tmass_ccflg]
column.summary: 2MASS contamination flag

column.name: [tmass_extkey]
column.summary: 2MASS Extended Source Catalog ID of associated source

column.name: [tmass_gal_contam]
column.summary: 2MASS galaxy contamination flag

table.name: [dbo].[apogeePlate]
table.summary: Contains all the information associated with an APOGEE plate.
table.remarks: This table contains the parameters for an APOGEE spectral plate

column.name: [plate_visit_id]
column.summary: Unique ID for plate visit, of form apogee.[telescope].[cs].plate.mjd (Primary key)

column.name: [location_id]
column.summary: Location ID (Foreign key)

column.name: [plate]
column.summary: Plate of this visit

column.name: [mjd]
column.summary: MJD of this visit

column.name: [apred_version]
column.summary: Visit reduction pipeline version

column.name: [name]
column.summary: Name of location that this plate belongs to

column.name: [racen]
column.summary: Right ascension, J2000, of plate center

column.name: [deccen]
column.summary: Declination, J2000, of plate center

column.name: [radius]
column.summary: Utilized radius of plate

column.name: [shared]
column.summary: If set to 1, a plate shared with another survey (0 if not)

column.name: [field_type]
column.summary: Type of field

column.name: [survey]
column.summary: Survey name

column.name: [programname]
column.summary: Program name within survey

column.name: [platerun]
column.summary: Plate run in which plate was drilled

column.name: [designid]
column.summary: Design ID associated with plate (Foreign key)

column.name: [nStandard]
column.summary: Number of standard stars on plate

column.name: [nScience]
column.summary: Number of science stars on plate

column.name: [nSky]
column.summary: Number of sky fibers on plate

column.name: [platedesign_version]
column.summary: Version of platedesign used to create plate design

table.name: [dbo].[apogeeStar]
table.summary: Contains data for an APOGEE star combined spectrum.
table.remarks: This table contains the data in the combined spectrum for an APOGEE star.

column.name: [apstar_id]
column.summary: Unique ID for combined star spectrum of form apogee.[telescope].[cs].apstar_version.location_id.apogee_id (Primary key)

column.name: [target_id]
column.summary: target ID (Foreign key, of form [location_id].[apogee_id])

column.name: [reduction_id]
column.summary: ID star identification used within reductions

column.name: [file]
column.summary: File base name with combined star spectrum

column.name: [apogee_id]
column.summary: 2MASS-style star identification

column.name: [telescope]
column.summary: Telescope where data was taken

column.name: [location_id]
column.summary: Location ID for the field this visit is in (Foreign key)

column.name: [field]
column.summary: Name of field

column.name: [ra]
column.summary: Right ascension, J2000

column.name: [dec]
column.summary: Declination, J2000

column.name: [cx]
column.summary: Cartesian X (J2000)

column.name: [cy]
column.summary: Cartesian Y (J2000)

column.name: [cz]
column.summary: Cartesian Z (J2000)

column.name: [htmID]
column.summary: HTM ID (J2000)

column.name: [zoneID]
column.summary: Zone ID

column.name: [glon]
column.summary: Galactic longitude

column.name: [glat]
column.summary: Galactic latitude

column.name: [apogee_target1]
column.summary: APOGEE target flag (first 64 bits)

column.name: [apogee_target2]
column.summary: APOGEE target flag (second 64 bits)

column.name: [extratarg]
column.summary: Shorthand flag to denote not a main survey object

column.name: [nvisits]
column.summary: Number of visits contributing to the combined spectrum

column.name: [commiss]
column.summary: Set to 1 if this is commissioning data

column.name: [snr]
column.summary: Median signal-to-noise ratio per pixel

column.name: [starflag]
column.summary: Bit mask with APOGEE star flags; each bit is set here if it is set in any visit

column.name: [andflag]
column.summary: AND of visit bit mask with APOGEE star flags; each bit is set if set in all visits

column.name: [vhelio_avg]
column.summary: Signal-to-noise weighted average of heliocentric radial velocity, as determined relative to combined spectrum, with zeropoint from xcorr of combined spectrum with best-fitting template

column.name: [vscatter]
column.summary: Standard deviation of scatter of individual visit RVs around average

column.name: [verr]
column.summary: Weighted error of heliocentric RV

column.name: [verr_med]
column.summary: Median of individual visit RV errors

column.name: [synthvhelio_avg]
column.summary: Signal-to-noise weighted average of heliocentric radial velocity relative to single best-fit synthetic template

column.name: [synthvscatter]
column.summary: Standard deviation of scatter of visit radial velocities determined from combined spectrum and best-fit synthetic template

column.name: [synthverr]
column.summary: Error in signal-to-noise weighted average of heliocentric radial velocity relative to single best-fit synthetic template

column.name: [synthverr_med]
column.summary: Median of individual visit synthetic RV errors

column.name: [rv_teff]
column.summary: effective temperature from RV template match

column.name: [rv_logg]
column.summary: log g from RV template match

column.name: [rv_feh]
column.summary: [Fe/H] from RV template match

column.name: [rv_ccfwhm]
column.summary: FWHM of cross-correlation peak from combined vs best-match synthetic spectrum

column.name: [rv_autofwhm]
column.summary: FWHM of auto-correlation of best-match synthetic spectrum

column.name: [synthscatter]
column.summary: scatter between RV using combined spectrum and RV using synthetic spectrum

column.name: [stablerv_chi2]
column.summary: Chi-squared of RV distribution under assumption of a stable single-valued RV; perhaps not currently useful because of issues with understanding RV errors

column.name: [stablerv_rchi2]
column.summary: Reduced chi^2 of RV distribution

column.name: [chi2_threshold]
column.summary: Threshold chi^2 for possible binary determination (not currently valid)

column.name: [stablerv_chi2_prob]
column.summary: Probability of obtaining observed chi^2 under assumption of stable RV

column.name: [apstar_version]
column.summary: Reduction version of spectrum combination

table.name: [dbo].[apogeeStarAllVisit]
table.summary: Links an APOGEE combined star spectrum with all visits for that star.
table.remarks: This is a linking table that links an APOGEE combined star spectrum with all the visits for that star, including good, bad, commsssioning, not, etc.

column.name: [visit_id]
column.summary: Unique ID for visit spectrum, of form apogee.[telescope].[cs].[apred_version].plate.mjd.fiberid

column.name: [apstar_id]
column.summary: Unique ID for combined star spectrum of form apogee.[telescope].[cs].apstar_version.location_id.apogee_id

table.name: [dbo].[apogeeStarVisit]
table.summary: Contains the ApogeeStarFlag flag values from DataConstants as binary(4).
table.remarks: Please see the APOGEE_STARFLAG entry in Algorithms under Bitmasks for further information.

column.name: [visit_id]
column.summary: Unique ID for visit spectrum, of form apogee.[telescope].[cs].[apred_version].plate.mjd.fiberid

column.name: [apstar_id]
column.summary: Unique ID for combined star spectrum of form apogee.[telescope].[cs].apstar_version.location_id.apogee_id

table.name: [dbo].[apogeeVisit]
table.summary: Contains data for a particular APOGEE spectrum visit.
table.remarks: This table corresponds to the data in a single spectrum visit in APOGEE

column.name: [visit_id]
column.summary: Unique ID for visit spectrum, of form apogee.[telescope].[cs].[apred_version].plate.mjd.fiberid (Primary key)

column.name: [apred_version]
column.summary: Visit reduction pipeline version (e.g. "r3")

column.name: [apogee_id]
column.summary: 2MASS-style star identification

column.name: [target_id]
column.summary: target ID (Foreign key, of form [location_id].[apogee_id])

column.name: [reduction_id]
column.summary: ID star identification used within reductions

column.name: [file]
column.summary: File base name with visit spectrum and catalog information

column.name: [telescope]
column.summary: Telescope where data was taken

column.name: [fiberid]
column.summary: Fiber ID for this visit

column.name: [plate]
column.summary: Plate of this visit

column.name: [mjd]
column.summary: MJD of this visit

column.name: [location_id]
column.summary: Location ID for the field this visit is in (Foreign key)

column.name: [ra]
column.summary: Right ascension, J2000

column.name: [dec]
column.summary: Declination, J2000

column.name: [glon]
column.summary: Galactic longitude

column.name: [glat]
column.summary: Galactic latitude

column.name: [apogee_target1]
column.summary: APOGEE target flag (first 64 bits)

column.name: [apogee_target2]
column.summary: APOGEE target flag (second 64 bits)

column.name: [extratarg]
column.summary: Shorthand flag to denote not a main survey object

column.name: [snr]
column.summary: Median signal-to-noise ratio per pixel

column.name: [starflag]
column.summary: Bit mask with APOGEE star flags

column.name: [dateobs]
column.summary: Date of observation (YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SS.SSS)

column.name: [jd]
column.summary: Julian date of observation

column.name: [bc]
column.summary: Barycentric correction (VHELIO - VREL)

column.name: [vtype]
column.summary: Radial velocity method (1 = chi-squared, 2 = cross-correlation, 3 = refined cross-correlation)

column.name: [vrel]
column.summary: Derived radial velocity

column.name: [vrelerr]
column.summary: Derived radial velocity error

column.name: [vhelio]
column.summary: Derived heliocentric radial velocity

column.name: [chisq]
column.summary: Chi-squared of match to TV template

column.name: [rv_feh]
column.summary: [Fe/H] of radial velocity template

column.name: [rv_teff]
column.summary: Effective temperature of radial velocity template

column.name: [rv_logg]
column.summary: Log gravity of radial velocity template

column.name: [rv_alpha]
column.summary: [alpha/M] alpha-element abundance

column.name: [rv_carb]
column.summary: [C/H] carbon abundance

column.name: [synthfile]
column.summary: File name of synthetic grid

column.name: [estvtype]
column.summary: Initial radial velocity method for individual visit RV estimate (1 = chi-squared, 2 = cross-correlation)

column.name: [estvrel]
column.summary: Initial radial velocity for individual visit RV estimate

column.name: [estvrelerr]
column.summary: Error in initial radial velocity for individual visit RV estimate

column.name: [estvhelio]
column.summary: Initial heliocentric radial velocity for individual visit RV estimate

column.name: [synthvrel]
column.summary: Radial velocity from cross-correlation of individual visit against final template

column.name: [synthvrelerr]
column.summary: Radial velocity error from cross-correlation of individual visit against final template

column.name: [synthvhelio]
column.summary: Heliocentric radial velocity from cross-correlation of individual visit against final template

table.name: [dbo].[aspcapStar]
table.summary: Contains data for an APOGEE star ASPCAP entry.
table.remarks: This table contains the data in the ASPCAP entry for an APOGEE star.

column.name: [apstar_id]
column.summary: Unique ID of combined star spectrum on which these results are based (Foreign key)

column.name: [target_id]
column.summary: target ID (Foreign key, of form [location_id].[apogee_id])

column.name: [aspcap_id]
column.summary: Unique ID for ASPCAP results of form apogee.[telescope].[cs].results_version.location_id.star (Primary key)

column.name: [apogee_id]
column.summary: 2MASS-style star identification

column.name: [aspcap_version]
column.summary: reduction version of ASPCAP

column.name: [results_version]
column.summary: reduction version of for post-processing

column.name: [teff]
column.summary: Empirically calibrated temperature from ASPCAP

column.name: [teff_err]
column.summary: external uncertainty estimate for calibrated temperature from ASPCAP

column.name: [teff_flag]
column.summary: PARAMFLAG for effective temperature

column.name: [logg]
column.summary: empirically calibrated log gravity from ASPCAP

column.name: [logg_err]
column.summary: external uncertainty estimate for log gravity from ASPCAP

column.name: [logg_flag]
column.summary: PARAMFLAG for log g

column.name: [aspcap_chi2]
column.summary: chi^2 of ASPCAP fit

column.name: [aspcap_class]
column.summary: Temperature class of best-fitting spectrum

column.name: [aspcapflag]
column.summary: Bitmask flag relating results of ASPCAP

column.name: [fparam_teff]
column.summary: original fit temperature

column.name: [fparam_logg]
column.summary: original fit log g from 6-parameter FERRE fit

column.name: [fparam_logvmicro]
column.summary: log10 of the fit microturbulent velocity in km/s from 6-parameter FERRE fit

column.name: [fparam_m_h]
column.summary: original fit [M/H] from 6-parameter FERRE fit

column.name: [fparam_c_m]
column.summary: original fit [C/H] from 6-parameter FERRE fit

column.name: [fparam_n_m]
column.summary: original fit [N/H] from 6-parameter FERRE fit

column.name: [fparam_alpha_m]
column.summary: original fit [alpha/M] from 6-parameter FERRE fit

column.name: [param_teff]
column.summary: Empirically calibrated temperature from ASPCAP

column.name: [param_logg]
column.summary: Empirically calibrated surface gravity from ASPCAP

column.name: [param_logvmicro]
column.summary: log10 of the empirically calibrated microturbulent velocity in km/s from ASPCAP

column.name: [param_logvmicro_flag]
column.summary: PARAMFLAG microturbulent velocity

column.name: [param_m_h]
column.summary: empirically calibrated metal abundances [M/H] from ASPCAP

column.name: [param_m_h_err]
column.summary: external uncertainty for empirically calibrated metal abundances [M/H] from ASPCAP

column.name: [param_m_h_flag]
column.summary: PARAMFLAG for [M/H]

column.name: [param_c_m]
column.summary: empirically calibrated [C/M] from ASPCAP

column.name: [param_c_m_flag]
column.summary: PARAMFLAG for [C/M]

column.name: [param_n_m]
column.summary: empirically calibrated [N/M] from ASPCAP

column.name: [param_n_m_flag]
column.summary: PARAMFLAG for [N/M]

column.name: [param_alpha_m]
column.summary: empirically calibrated [alpha/M] from ASPCAP

column.name: [param_alpha_m_err]
column.summary: external uncertainty for empirically calibrated [alpha/M] from ASPCAP

column.name: [param_alpha_m_flag]
column.summary: PARAMFLAG for [alpha/M]

column.name: [al_h]
column.summary: empirically calibrated [Al/H] from ASPCAP

column.name: [al_h_err]
column.summary: external uncertainty for empirically calibrated [Al/H] from ASPCAP

column.name: [al_h_flag]
column.summary: ELEMFLAG for Al

column.name: [c_h]
column.summary: empirically calibrated [C/H] from ASPCAP; [C/H] is calculated as (ASPCAP [C/M])+param_metals

column.name: [c_h_err]
column.summary: external uncertainty for empirically calibrated [C/H] from ASPCAP

column.name: [c_h_flag]
column.summary: ELEMFLAG for C

column.name: [ca_h]
column.summary: empirically calibrated [Ca/H] from ASPCAP ; [Ca/H] is calculated as (ASPCAP [Ca/M])+param_metals

column.name: [ca_h_err]
column.summary: external uncertainty for empirically calibrated [Ca/H] from ASPCAP

column.name: [ca_h_flag]
column.summary: ELEMFLAG for Ca

column.name: [fe_h]
column.summary: empirically calibrated [Fe/H] from ASPCAP

column.name: [fe_h_err]
column.summary: external uncertainty for empirically calibrated [Fe/H] from ASPCAP

column.name: [fe_h_flag]
column.summary: ELEMFLAG for Fe

column.name: [k_h]
column.summary: empirically calibrated [K/H] from ASPCAP

column.name: [k_h_err]
column.summary: external uncertainty for empirically calibrated [K/H] from ASPCAP

column.name: [k_h_flag]

column.name: [mg_h]
column.summary: empirically calibrated [Mg/H] from ASPCAP; [Mg/H] is calculated as (ASPCAP [Mg/M])+param_metals

column.name: [mg_h_err]
column.summary: external uncertainty for empirically calibrated [Mg/H] from ASPCAP

column.name: [mg_h_flag]
column.summary: ELEMFLAG for Mg

column.name: [mn_h]
column.summary: empirically calibrated [Mn/H] from ASPCAP

column.name: [mn_h_err]
column.summary: external uncertainty for empirically calibrated [Mn/H] from ASPCAP

column.name: [mn_h_flag]
column.summary: ELEMFLAG for Mn

column.name: [na_h]
column.summary: empirically calibrated [Na/H] from ASPCAP

column.name: [na_h_err]
column.summary: external uncertainty for empirically calibrated [Na/H] from ASPCAP

column.name: [na_h_flag]
column.summary: ELEMFLAG for Na

column.name: [ni_h]
column.summary: empirically calibrated [Ni/H] from ASPCAP

column.name: [ni_h_err]
column.summary: external uncertainty for empirically calibrated [Ni/H] from ASPCAP

column.name: [ni_h_flag]
column.summary: ELEMFLAG for Ni

column.name: [n_h]
column.summary: empirically calibrated [N/H] from ASPCAP; [N/H] is calculated as (ASPCAP [N/M])+param_metals

column.name: [n_h_err]
column.summary: external uncertainty for empirically calibrated [N/H] from ASPCAP

column.name: [n_h_flag]
column.summary: ELEMFLAG for N

column.name: [o_h]
column.summary: empirically calibrated [O/H] from ASPCAP; [O/H] is calculated as (ASPCAP [O/M])+param_metals

column.name: [o_h_err]

column.name: [o_h_flag]

column.name: [si_h]

column.name: [si_h_err]

column.name: [si_h_flag]

column.name: [s_h]

column.name: [s_h_flag]

table.name: [dbo].[aspcapStarCovar]
table.summary: Contains the covariance information for an APOGEE star ASPCAP entry.
table.remarks: This table contains selected covariance matrix fields for the ASPCAP entry for an APOGEE star.

column.name: [aspcap_covar_id]
column.summary: Unique ID for this covariance matrix element of form apogee.[telescope].[cs].results_version.location_id.star.param_1.param_2 (Primary key)

column.name: [aspcap_id]
column.summary: Unique ID for ASPCAP results of form apogee.[telescope].[cs].results_version.location_id.star

column.name: [param_1]
column.summary: Parameter #1 in covariance (0..6, corresponding to Teff, log(g), log(vmicro), [M/H], [C/M], [N/M], [alpha/M])

column.name: [param_2]
column.summary: Parameter #2 in covariance (0..6, corresponding to Teff, log(g), log(vmicro), [M/H], [C/M], [N/M], [alpha/M])

column.name: [covar]
column.summary: Covariance between two parameters for this star (external estimate)

column.name: [fit_covar]
column.summary: Covariance between two parameters for this star (internal estimate for original fit values)

table.name: [dbo].[DataConstants]
table.summary: The table stores the values of various enumerated and bitmask columns.

column.name: [field]
column.summary: Field Name

column.name: [name]
column.summary: Constant Name

column.name: [value]
column.summary: Type value

column.name: [description]
column.summary: Short description

table.name: [dbo].[detectionIndex]
table.summary: Full list of all detections, with associated 'thing' assignment.
table.remarks: Each row in this table corresponds to a single catalog entry, or 'detection' in the SDSS imaging. For each one, this table lists a 'thingId', which is common among all detections of the same object in the catalog.

column.name: [thingId]
column.summary: thing ID number

column.name: [objId]
column.summary: object ID number (from run, camcol, field, id, rerun)

column.name: [isPrimary]
column.summary: 1 if object is primary, 0 if not

column.name: [loadVersion]
column.summary: Load Version

table.name: [dbo].[emissionLinesPort]
table.summary: Emission line kinematics results for SDSS and BOSS galaxies using GANDALF
table.remarks: We fit galaxies using an adaptation of the publicly available Gas AND Absorption Line Fitting (GANDALF, Sarzi et al. 2006) and penalised PiXel Fitting (pPXF, Cappellari & Emsellem 2004). Stellar population models for the continuum are from of Maraston & Strömbäck (2011) and Thomas, Maraston & Johansson (2011).

column.name: [specObjID]
column.summary: Unique ID

column.name: [plate]
column.summary: Plate number

column.name: [fiberID]
column.summary: Fiber ID

column.name: [mjd]
column.summary: MJD of observation

column.name: [ra]
column.summary: Right ascension of fiber, J2000

column.name: [dec]
column.summary: Declination of fiber, J2000

column.name: [z]
column.summary: Redshift used (corresponds to z_noqso in specObjAll)

column.name: [zErr]
column.summary: Error in z (corresponds to zErr_noqso in specObjAll)

column.name: [zNum]
column.summary: Index of chi^2 minimum corresponding to z_noqso

column.name: [velStars]
column.summary: stellar velocity

column.name: [redshift]
column.summary: GANDALF-corrected redshift

column.name: [sigmaStars]
column.summary: Stellar velocity dispersion

column.name: [sigmaStarsErr]
column.summary: Error on measurement of stellar velocity dispersion

column.name: [chisq]
column.summary: chi-squared of best-fit template

column.name: [bpt]
column.summary: Classification from Kauffmann et al. (2003), Kewley et al. (2001) and Schawinski et al. (2007) for objects with the emission lines Hβ, [OIII], Hα, [NII] [available] with A/N > 1.5. Possible values: "BLANK" (if emission lines not available), "Star Forming", "Seyfert", "LINER", "Seyfert/LINER", "Composite"

column.name: [ebmv]
column.summary: E(B-V) for internal reddening estimated from emission lines

column.name: [ebmv_err]
column.summary: Error in E(B-V)for internal reddening estimated from emission lines

column.name: [Error_Warning]
column.summary: Set to 1 if error calculation failed (errors all set to zero in that case); otherwise, set to 0

table.name: [dbo].[Field]

table.remarks: A field is a 2048x1489 pixel section of a camera column. This table contains summary results of the photometric and calibration pipelines for each field.

table.name: [dbo].[galSpecExtra]
table.summary: Estimated physical parameters for all galaxies in the MPA-JHU spectroscopic catalogue.
table.remarks: These parameters give the probability distribution of each parameter in terms of its percent quantiles. These estimates are derived in the manner described in Brinchmann et al. 2004

column.name: [specObjID]
column.summary: Unique ID

column.name: [bptclass]
column.summary: Emission line classification based on the BPT diagram using the methodology described in Brinchmann et al (2004). -1 means unclassifiable, 1 is star-forming, 2 means low S/N star-forming, 3 is composite, 4 AGN (excluding liners) and 5 is a low S/N LINER.

column.name: [oh_p2p5]
column.summary: The 2.5 percentile of the Oxygen abundance derived using Charlot & Longhetti models. The values are reported as 12 + Log O/H. See Tremonti et al (2004) and Brinchmann et al (2004) for details.

column.name: [oh_p16]
column.summary: The 16 percentile of the Oxygen abundance derived using Charlot & Longhetti models. The values are reported as 12 + Log O/H. See Tremonti et al (2004) and Brinchmann et al (2004) for details.

column.name: [oh_p50]
column.summary: The median estimate of the Oxygen abundance derived using Charlot & Longhetti models. The values are reported as 12 + Log O/H. See Tremonti et al (2004) and Brinchmann et al (2004) for details.

column.name: [oh_p84]
column.summary: The 84th percentile of the Oxygen abundance derived using Charlot & Longhetti models. The values are reported as 12 + Log O/H. See Tremonti et al (2004) and Brinchmann et al (2004) for details.

column.name: [oh_p97p5]
column.summary: The 97.5 percentile of the Oxygen abundance derived using Charlot & Longhetti models. The values are reported as 12 + Log O/H. See Tremonti et al (2004) and Brinchmann et al (2004) for details.

column.name: [oh_entropy]
column.summary: The entropy (Sum p*lg(p)) of the PDF of 12 + Log O/H

column.name: [lgm_tot_p2p5]

column.name: [lgm_tot_p16]
column.summary: The 16th percentile of the Log total stellar mass PDF using model photometry.

column.name: [lgm_tot_p50]
column.summary: The median estimate of the Log total stellar mass PDF using model photometry.

column.name: [lgm_tot_p84]
column.summary: The 84th percentile of the Log total stellar mass PDF using model photometry.

column.name: [lgm_tot_p97p5]
column.summary: The 97.5 percentile of the Log total stellar mass PDF using model photometry.

column.name: [lgm_fib_p2p5]
column.summary: The 2.5 percentile of the Log stellar mass within the fibre PDF using fibre photometry.

column.name: [lgm_fib_p16]
column.summary: The 16th percentile of the Log stellar mass within the fibre PDF using fibre photometry.

column.name: [lgm_fib_p97p5]
column.summary: The 97.5 percentile of the Log stellar mass within the fibre PDF using fibre photometry.

column.name: [sfr_tot_p2p5]
column.summary: The 2.5 percentile of the Log total SFR PDF. This is derived by combining emission line measurements from within the fibre where possible and aperture corrections are done by fitting models ala Gallazzi et al (2005), Salim et al (2007) to the photometry outside the fibre. For those objects where the emission lines within the fibre do not provide an estimate of the SFR, model fits were made to the integrated photometry.

column.name: [sfr_tot_p16]
column.summary: The 16th percentile of the Log total SFR PDF. This is derived by combining emission line measurements from within the fibre where possible and aperture corrections are done by fitting models ala Gallazzi et al (2005), Salim et al (2007) to the photometry outside the fibre. For those objects where the emission lines within the fibre do not provide an estimate of the SFR, model fits were made to the integrated photometry.

column.name: [sfr_tot_p50]
column.summary: The median estimate of the Log total SFR PDF. This is derived by combining emission line measurements from within the fibre where possible and aperture corrections are done by fitting models ala Gallazzi et al (2005), Salim et al (2007) to the photometry outside the fibre. For those objects where the emission lines within the fibre do not provide an estimate of the SFR, model fits were made to the integrated photometry.

column.name: [sfr_tot_p84]
column.summary: The 84th percentile of the Log total SFR PDF. This is derived by combining emission line measurements from within the fibre where possible and aperture corrections are done by fitting models ala Gallazzi et al (2005), Salim et al (2007) to the photometry outside the fibre. For those objects where the emission lines within the fibre do not provide an estimate of the SFR, model fits were made to the integrated photometry.

column.name: [sfr_tot_p97p5]
column.summary: The 97.5 percentile of the Log total SFR PDF. This is derived by combining emission line measurements from within the fibre where possible and aperture corrections are done by fitting models ala Gallazzi et al (2005), Salim et al (2007) to the photometry outside the fibre. For those objects where the emission lines within the fibre do not provide an estimate of the SFR, model fits were made to the integrated photometry.

column.name: [sfr_tot_entropy]
column.summary: The entropy (Sum p*lg(p)) of the PDF of the total SFR

column.name: [sfr_fib_p2p5]
column.summary: The 2.5 percentile of the Log SFR within the fiber PDF. For galaxies of the star-forming class, emission lines were used (c.f. Brinchmann et al 2004) while for others models were fit to the fibre photometry..

column.name: [sfr_fib_p16]
column.summary: The 16th percentile of the Log SFR within the fiber PDF. For galaxies of the star-forming class, emission lines were used (c.f. Brinchmann et al 2004) while for others models were fit to the fibre photometry..

column.name: [sfr_fib_p50]
column.summary: The median estimate of the Log SFR within the fiber PDF. For galaxies of the star-forming class, emission lines were used (c.f. Brinchmann et al 2004) while for others models were fit to the fibre photometry..

column.name: [sfr_fib_entropy]
column.summary: The entropy (Sum p*lg(p)) of the PDF of the fiber SFR

This is derived by combining emission line measurements from within the fibre where possible and aperture corrections are done by fitting models ala Gallazzi et al (2005), Salim et al (2007) to the photometry outside the fibre. For those objects where the emission lines within the fibre do not provide an estimate of the SFR, model fits were made to the integrated photometry.

column.summary: The 97.5 percentile of the Log total SPECSFR PDF. This is derived by combining emission line measurements from within the fibre where possible and aperture corrections are done by fitting models ala Gallazzi et al (2005), Salim et al (2007) to the photometry outside the fibre. For those objects where the emission lines within the fibre do not provide an estimate of the SFR, model fits were made to the integrated photometry.

column.name: [specsfr_tot_entropy]
column.summary: The entropy (Sum p*lg(p)) of the PDF of the total SPECSFR

column.name: [specsfr_fib_p2p5]
column.summary: The 2.5 percentile of the Log SPECSFR within the fiber PDF. For galaxies of the star-forming class, emission lines were used (c.f. Brinchmann et al 2004) while for others models were fit to the fibre photometry..

column.name: [specsfr_fib_p16]
column.summary: The 16th percentile of the Log SPECSFR within the fiber PDF. For galaxies of the star-forming class, emission lines were used (c.f. Brinchmann et al 2004) while for others models were fit to the fibre photometry..

column.name: [specsfr_fib_p50]
column.summary: The median estimate of the Log SPECSFR within the fiber PDF. For galaxies of the star-forming class, emission lines were used (c.f. Brinchmann et al 2004) while for others models were fit to the fibre photometry..

column.name: [specsfr_fib_p84]
column.summary: The 84th percentile of the Log SPECSFR within the fiber PDF. For galaxies of the star-forming class, emission lines were used (c.f. Brinchmann et al 2004) while for others models were fit to the fibre photometry..

column.name: [specsfr_fib_p97p5]
column.summary: The 97.5 percentile of the Log SPECSFR within the fiber PDF. For galaxies of the star-forming class, emission lines were used (c.f. Brinchmann et al 2004) while for others models were fit to the fibre photometry..

column.name: [specsfr_fib_entropy]
column.summary: The entropy (Sum p*lg(p)) of the PDF of the fiber SPECSFR

table.name: [dbo].[galSpecInfo]
table.summary: General information for the MPA-JHU spectroscopic re-analysis
table.remarks: This table contains one entry per spectroscopic observation It may be joined with the other galSpec tables with the measurements, or to specObjAll, using specObjId. Numbers given here are for the version of data used by the MPA-JHU and may not be in perfect agreement with specObjAll.

column.name: [specObjID]
column.summary: Unique ID

column.name: [plateid]
column.summary: Plate number

column.name: [mjd]
column.summary: Modified Julian Date of plate observation

column.name: [fiberid]
column.summary: Fiber number (1 - 640)

column.name: [ra]
column.summary: Right Ascention of drilled fiber position

column.name: [dec]
column.summary: Declination of drilled fiber position

column.name: [primtarget]
column.summary: Primary Target Flag (MAIN galaxy = 64)

column.name: [sectarget]
column.summary: Secondary Target Flag (QA = 8)

column.name: [targettype]
column.summary: Text version of primary target (GALAXY/QA/QSO/ROSAT_D)

column.name: [spectrotype]
column.summary: Schlegel classification of spectrum ... code is only run where this is set to "GALAXY"

column.name: [subclass]
column.summary: Schlegel subclass from PCA analysis -- not alwasy correct!! AGN/BROADLINE/STARBURST/STARFORMING

column.name: [z]
column.summary: Redshift from Schlegel

column.name: [z_err]
column.summary: Redshift error

column.name: [z_warning]
column.summary: Bad redshift if this is non-zero -- see Schlegel data model

column.name: [v_disp]
column.summary: Velocity dispersion from Schlegel

column.name: [v_disp_err]
column.summary: Velocity dispersion error (negative for invalid fit)

column.name: [sn_median]
column.summary: Median S/N per pixel of the whole spectrum

column.name: [e_bv_sfd]
column.summary: E(B-V) of foreground reddening from SFD maps

column.name: [release]
column.summary: Data Release (dr1/dr2/dr3/dr4)

column.name: [reliable]
column.summary: has "reliable" line measurements and physical parameters

table.name: [dbo].[galSpecLine]
table.summary: Emission line measurements from MPA-JHU spectroscopic reanalysis
table.remarks: The table contains one entry per spectroscopic observation derived as described in Tremonti et al (2004) and Brinchmann et al (2004).

column.name: [specObjID]
column.summary: Unique ID

column.name: [sigma_balmer]
column.summary: Velocity dispersion (sigma not FWHM) measured simultaneously in all of the Balmer lines

column.name: [sigma_balmer_err]
column.summary: Error in the above

column.name: [sigma_forbidden]
column.summary: Velocity dispersion (sigma not FWHM) measured simultaneously in all the forbidden lines

column.name: [sigma_forbidden_err]
column.summary: Error in the above

column.name: [v_off_balmer]
column.summary: Velocity offset of the Balmer lines from the measured redshift

column.name: [v_off_balmer_err]
column.summary: Error in the above

column.name: [v_off_forbidden]
column.summary: Velocity offset of the forbidden lines from the measured redshift

column.name: [v_off_forbidden_err]
column.summary: Error in the above

column.name: [oii_3726_cont]
column.summary: Continuum at line center from 200 pixel median smoothing of the emission-line subtracted continuum

column.name: [oii_3726_cont_err]
column.summary: Error in the continuum computed from the variance in the band pass

column.name: [oii_3726_reqw]
column.summary: The equivalent width of the continuum-subtracted emission line computed from straight integration over the bandpasses listed below (emisison is negative). In this case the continuum comes from a running 200 pixel median and does not properly account for stellar absorption. In general the EQW measurements provide a better measure of the true equivalent width. The purpose of this measurement is to help characterize the stellar absorption effecting the line. (EW_stellar = REQW - EQW)

column.name: [oii_3726_reqw_err]
column.summary: Error in the equivalent width described above

column.name: [oii_3726_eqw]
column.summary: The equivalent width of the CB08 continuum-subtracted emission line computed from straight integration over the bandpasses listed below (emisison is negative) . This properly takes into account stellar absorption. Note that it will not be correct in the case of blended lines (ie NII & H-alpha) -- instead use FLUX/CONT.

column.name: [oii_3726_eqw_err]
column.summary: Error in the equivalent width described above

column.name: [oii_3726_flux]
column.summary: Flux from Gaussian fit to continuum subtracted data. (Note that the fit is done simultaneously to all the lines so de-blending happens automatically)

column.name: [oii_3726_flux_err]
column.summary: Error in the flux

column.name: [oii_3726_inst_res]
column.summary: Instrumental resolution at the line center (measured for each spectrum from the ARC lamps)

column.name: [oii_3726_chisq]
column.summary: Reduced chi-squared of the line fit over the bandpass used for the EW measurement

column.summary: The equivalent width of the continuum-subtracted emission line computed from straight integration over the bandpasses listed below (emisison is negative). In this case the continuum comes from a running 200 pixel median and does not properly account for stellar absorption. In general the EQW measurements provide a better measure of the true equivalent width. The purpose of this measurement is to help characterize the stellar absorption effecting the line. (EW_stellar = REQW - EQW)

column.name: [ariii7135_reqw_err]
column.summary: Error in the equivalent width described above

column.name: [ariii7135_eqw]
column.summary: The equivalent width of the CB08 continuum-subtracted emission line computed from straight integration over the bandpasses listed below (emisison is negative) . This properly takes into account stellar absorption. Note that it will not be correct in the case of blended lines (ie NII & H-alpha) -- instead use FLUX/CONT.

column.name: [ariii7135_eqw_err]
column.summary: Error in the equivalent width described above

column.name: [ariii7135_flux]
column.summary: Flux from Gaussian fit to continuum subtracted data. (Note that the fit is done simultaneously to all the lines so de-blending happens automatically)

column.name: [ariii7135_flux_err]
column.summary: Error in the flux

column.name: [ariii7135_inst_res]
column.summary: Instrumental resolution at the line center (measured for each spectrum from the ARC lamps)

column.name: [ariii7135_chisq]
column.summary: Reduced chi-squared of the line fit over the bandpass used for the EW measurement

column.name: [oii_sigma]
column.summary: The width of the [O II] line in a free fit (ie. not tied to other emission lines)

column.name: [oii_flux]
column.summary: The flux of the [O II] doublet from a free fit.

column.name: [oii_flux_err]
column.summary: The estimated uncertainty on OII_FLUX

column.name: [oii_voff]
column.summary: The velocity offset of the [O II] doublet from a free fit

column.name: [oii_chi2]
column.summary: chi^2 of the fit to the [O II] line in free fit

column.name: [oiii_sigma]
column.summary: The width of the [O III]5007 line in a free fit (ie. not tied to other emission lines)

column.name: [oiii_flux]
column.summary: The flux of the [O III]5007 line from a free fit.

column.name: [oiii_flux_err]
column.summary: The estimated uncertainty on OIII_FLUX

column.name: [oiii_voff]
column.summary: The velocity offset of the [O III]5007 line from a free fit

column.name: [oiii_chi2]
column.summary: chi^2 of the fit to the [O III]5007 line in free fit

column.name: CONSTRAINT
column.summary: The multiplicative scale factor applied to the original flux and error spectra prior to measurement of the emission lines to improve the spectrophotometric accuracy. The rescaling insures that a synthetic r-band magnitude computed from the spectrum matches the r-band fiber magnitude measured by the photometric pipeline.

table.name: [dbo].[HalfSpace]
table.summary: The constraints for boundaries of the the different regions
table.remarks: Boundaries are represented as the equation of a 3D plane, intersecting the unit sphere. These intersections are great and small circles. THe representation is in terms of a 4-vector, (x,y,z,c), where (x,y,z) are the components of a 3D normal vector pointing along the normal of the plane into the half-scape inside our boundary, and c is the shift of the plane along the normal from the origin. Thus, c=0 constraints represent great circles. If c<0, the small circle contains more than half of the sky. See also the Region and RegionConvex tables

column.name: [constraintid]
column.summary: id for the constraint

column.name: [regionid]
column.summary: pointer to RegionDefs

column.name: [convexid]
column.summary: unique id for the convex

column.name: [x]
column.summary: x component of normal

column.name: [y]
column.summary: y component of normal

column.name: [z]
column.summary: z component of normal

column.name: [c]
column.summary: offset from center along normal

table.name: [dbo].[PhotoObjDR7]
table.summary: Contains the spatial cross-match between DR8 photoobj and DR7 photoobj.
table.remarks: This is a unique match between a DR8 photoobj and a DR7 photoobj, and matches are restricted to the same run/camcol/field. The match radius is 1 arcsec, and within this radius preference is given to a photoprimary match over a secondary. If no primary match exists, the nearest secondary match is chosen. If more than one match of a given mode exists, the nearest one is chosen. The table contains the DR8 and DR7 objids and modes, the distance between them, and the DR7 phototag quantities.

column.name: [dr7objid]
column.summary: Unique DR7 identifier composed from [skyVersion,rerun,run,camcol,field,obj].

column.name: [dr8objid]
column.summary: Unique DR8 identifier composed from [skyVersion,rerun,run,camcol,field,obj].

column.name: [distance]
column.summary: Distance in arcmin between the DR7 and DR8 positions

column.name: [modeDR7]
column.summary: DR7 mode, 1: primary, 2: secondary, 3: family object.

column.name: [modeDR8]
column.summary: DR8 mode, 1: primary, 2: secondary, 3: family object.

column.name: [skyVersion]
column.summary: 0 = OPDB target, 1 = OPDB best

column.summary: Run number

column.summary: Rerun number

column.name: [camcol]
column.summary: Camera column

column.name: [field]
column.summary: Field number

column.name: [obj]
column.summary: The object id within a field. Usually changes between reruns of the same field.

column.name: [nChild]
column.summary: Number of children if this is a composite object that has been deblended. BRIGHT (in a flags sense) objects also have nchild == 1, the non-BRIGHT sibling.

column.name: [type]

table.name: [dbo].[Photoz]
table.summary: The photometrically estimated redshifts for all objects in the GalaxyTag view.
table.remarks:
Estimation is based on a robust fit on spectroscopically observed objects with similar colors and r magnitude.
Please see the Photometric Redshifts entry in Algorithms for more information about this table.
NOTE: This table may be empty initially because the values are computed in a separate calculation after the main data release.

column.name: [objID]
column.summary: unique ID pointing to GalaxyTag table

column.name: [z]
column.summary: photometric redshift; estimated by robust fit to nearest neighbors in a reference set

column.name: [zErr]
column.summary: estimated error of the photometric redshift; if zErr=-9999, the fit failed, but the neighbors' average redshift might still be available

column.name: [nnCount]
column.summary: number of nearest neighbors after excluding the outliers; maximal value is 100, a much smaller value indicates a poor estimate

column.name: [nnVol]
column.summary: gives the color space bounding volume of the nnCount nearest neighbors; a large value indicates a poor estimate

column.name: [nnObjID]
column.summary: objID of the (first) nearest neighbor

column.name: [nnSpecz]
column.summary: spectroscopic redshift of the (first) nearest neighbor

column.name: [nnFarObjID]
column.summary: objID of the farthest neighbor

column.name: [nnAvgZ]
column.summary: average redshift of the nearest neighbors; if significantly different from z, this might be a better estimate than z

column.name: [distMod]
column.summary: the distance modulus for Omega=0.2739, Lambda=0.726, h=0.705 cosmology

column.name: [lumDist]
column.summary: the luminosity distance in Mpc for Omega=0.2739, Lambda=0.726, h=0.705 cosmology

column.name: [chisq]
column.summary: the chi-square value for the minimum chi-square template fit (non-reduced, 4 degrees of freedom)

column.name: [rnorm]
column.summary: the residual Euclidean norm value for the minimum chi-square template fit

column.name: [synthU]
column.summary: synthetic u' magnitude calculated from the fitted template

column.name: [synthG]
column.summary: synthetic g' magnitude calculated from the fitted template

column.name: [synthR]
column.summary: synthetic r' magnitude calculated from the fitted template

column.name: [synthI]
column.summary: synthetic i' magnitude calculated from the fitted template

column.name: [synthZ]
column.summary: synthetic z' magnitude calculated from the fitted template

column.name: [kcorrU]
column.summary: k correction for z=0

column.name: [kcorrG]
column.summary: k correction for z=0

column.summary: k correction for z=0

column.summary: k correction for z=0

column.name: [kcorrZ]
column.summary: k correction for z=0

column.summary: k correction for z=0.1

table.name: [dbo].[Plate2Target]
table.summary: Which objects are in the coverage area of which plates?
table.remarks: This table has an entry for each case of a target from the sppTargets table having been targetable by a given plate. Can be joined with plateX on the PLATEID column, and with sppTargets on the OBJID column. Some plates are included that were never observed; the PLATEID values for these will not match any entries in the plateX table.

column.name: [plate2targetid]
column.summary: primary key

column.name: [plate]
column.summary: plate number

column.name: [plateid]
column.summary: plate identification number in plateX

column.name: [objid]
column.summary: object identification number in sppTargets

column.name: [loadVersion]
column.summary: Load Version

table.name: [dbo].[PlateX]
table.summary: Contains data from a given plate used for spectroscopic observations.
table.remarks: Each SDSS spectrograph plate has 640 observed spectra, whereas each BOSS spectrograph plate has 1000 observed spectra.

column.name: [plateID]
column.summary: Unique ID, composite of plate number and MJD

column.name: [firstRelease]

column.name: [plate]
column.summary: Plate number

column.summary: MJD of observation (last)

table.remarks: These results are based on the technique described in Munn et al. 2004, AJ, 127, 3034

column.name: [delta]
column.summary: Distance between this object and the nearest matching USNO-B object.

column.name: [match]
column.summary: Number of objects in USNO-B which matched this object within a 1 arcsec radius. If negative, then the nearest matching USNO-B object itself matched more than 1 SDSS object.

column.name: [pmL]
column.summary: Proper motion in galactic longitude.

column.name: [pmB]
column.summary: Proper motion in galactic latitude.

column.name: [pmRa]
column.summary: Proper motion in right ascension.

column.name: [pmDec]
column.summary: Proper motion in declination.

column.name: [pmRaErr]
column.summary: Error in proper motion in right ascension.

column.name: [pmDecErr]
column.summary: Error in proper motion in declination.

column.name: [sigRa]
column.summary: RMS residual for the proper motion fit in r.a.

column.name: [sigDec]
column.summary: RMS residual for the proper motion fit in dec.

column.name: [nFit]
column.summary: Number of detections used in the fit including the SDSS detection (thus, the number of plates the object was detected on in USNO-B plus one).

column.name: [O]
column.summary: Recalibrated USNO-B O magnitude, recalibrated to SDSS g

column.name: [E]
column.summary: Recalibrated USNO-B E magnitude, recalibrated to SDSS r

column.name: [J]
column.summary: Recalibrated USNO-B J magnitude, recalibrated to SDSS g

column.name: [F]
column.summary: Recalibrated USNO-B F magnitude, recalibrated to SDSS r

column.name: [N]
column.summary: Recalibrated USNO-B N magnitude, recalibrated to SDSS i

column.name: [dist20]
column.summary: Distance to the nearest neighbor with g < 20

column.name: [dist22]
column.summary: Distance to the nearest neighbor with g < 22

column.name: [objid]
column.summary: unique id, points to photoObj

table.name: [dbo].[Region]
table.summary: Definition of the different regions
table.remarks:
We have various boundaries in the survey, represented by equations of 3D planes, intersecting the unit sphere, describing great and small circles, respectively. This table stores the description of a region, the details are in the HalfSpace table.
  • CHUNK - the boundary of a given Chunk
  • STRIPE - the boundary of the whole stripe
  • STAVE - the unique boundary of the whole stripe, agrees with STRIPE for Southern stripes
  • PRIMARY - the primary region of a given CHUNK
  • SEGMENT - the idealized boundary of a segment
  • CAMCOL - the real boundary of a segment
  • PLATE - the boundary of a plate
  • TILE - the boundary of a circular tile
  • TIGEOM - the boundary of a Tiling Run, also includes inverse regions, which must be excluded
  • RUN - the union of the CAMCOLs making up a Run
  • WEDGE -- intersection of tiles as booleans.
  • TILEBOX -- intersection of TIGEOM respecting masks (these are positive convex TIGEOM)
  • SKYBOX -- intersection and union of TILEBOX to cover the sky with positive disjoin convex regions.
  • SECTORLETS -- intersection of Skyboxes with wedges. These are the areas that have targets.
  • SECTORS -- collects together all the sectorlets with the same covering (and excluded) tiles.
    See also the RegionConvex and Halfspace tables

column.name: [id]
column.summary: key of the region pointing into other tables

column.name: [type]
column.summary: type of the region (STRIPE|STAVE|...)

column.name: [comment]
column.summary: description of the region

column.name: [ismask]
column.summary: 0: region, 1: to be excluded

column.name: [area]
column.summary: area of region

column.name: [regionString]
column.summary: the string representation of the region

column.name: [regionBinary]
column.summary: the precompiled XML description of region

table.name: [dbo].[Region2Box]
table.summary: Tracks the parentage which regions contribute to which boxes
table.remarks: For the sector computation, Region2Box tracks the parentage of which regions contribute to which boxs. TileRegions contribute to TileBoxes TileRegions and TileBoxes contribute to SkyBoxes Wedges and SkyBoxes contribute to Sectorlets Sectorlets contribute to Sectors

column.name: [regionType]
column.summary: type of parent, (TIGEOM)

column.name: [id]
column.summary: the object id of the other parent region

column.name: [boxType]
column.summary: type of child (TILEBOX, SKYBOX)

column.name: [boxid]
column.summary: regionid of child

table.name: [dbo].[RegionArcs]
table.summary: Contains the arcs of a Region with their endpoints
table.remarks: An arc has two endpoints, specified via their equatorial coordinates, and the equation of the circle (x,y,z,c) of the arc. The arc is directed, the first point is the beginning, the second is the end. The arc belongs to a Region, a Convex and a patch. A patch is a contigous area of the sky. Within a patch the consecutive arcids represent a counterclockwise ordering of the vertices.

column.name: [arcid]
column.summary: unique id of the arc

column.name: [regionid]
column.summary: unique region identifier

column.name: [convexid]
column.summary: convex identifier

column.name: [constraintid]
column.summary: id of the constraint

column.name: [patch]
column.summary: id of the patch

column.name: [state]
column.summary: state (3: bounding circle, 2:root, 1: hole)

column.name: [draw]
column.summary: 0:hide, 1: draw

column.name: [ra1]
column.summary: ra of starting point of arc

column.name: [dec1]
column.summary: dec of starting point of arc

column.name: [ra2]
column.summary: ra of end point of arc

column.name: [dec2]
column.summary: dec of end point of arc

column.name: [x]
column.summary: x of constraint normal vector

column.name: [y]
column.summary: y of constraint normal vector

column.name: [z]
column.summary: z of constraint normal vector

column.name: [c]
column.summary: offset of constraint

column.name: [length]
column.summary: length of arc in degrees

table.name: [dbo].[RegionPatch]
table.summary: Defines the attributes of the patches of a given region
table.remarks: Regions are the union of convex hulls and are defined in the Region table. Convexes are the intersection of halfspaces defined by the HalfSpace table. Each convex is then broken up into a set of Patches, with their own bounding circle. See also the Region table

column.name: [regionid]
column.summary: Unique Region ID

column.name: [convexid]
column.summary: Unique Convex ID

column.name: [patchid]
column.summary: Unique patch number

column.name: [type]
column.summary: CAMCOL, RUN, STAVE, TILE, TILEBOX, SKYBOX, WEDGE, SECTOR...

column.name: [radius]
column.summary: radius of bounding circle centered at ra, dec

column.name: [ra]
column.summary: right ascension of observation

column.name: [dec]
column.summary: declination of observation

column.name: [x]
column.summary: x of centerpoint Normal unit vector in J2000

column.name: [y]
column.summary: y of centerpoint Normal unit vector in J2000

column.name: [z]
column.summary: z of centerpoint Normal unit vector in J2000

column.name: [c]
column.summary: offset of the equation of plane

column.name: [htmid]
column.summary: 20 deep Hierarchical Triangular Mesh ID of centerpoint

column.name: [zoneid]
column.summary: 20 deep Hierarchical Triangular Mesh ID of centerpoint

column.name: [area]
column.summary: area of the patch

column.name: [convexString]
column.summary: {x,y,z,c}+ representation of the convex of the patch

table.name: [dbo].[Rmatrix]
table.summary: Contains various rotation matrices between spherical coordinate systems
table.remarks:
The mode field is a 3-letter code indicating the transformation:
  • S2J - Survey-to-J2000
  • G2J - Galactic-to-J2000
  • J2G - J2000-to-Galactic
  • J2S - J2000-to-Survey

table.name: [dbo].[RunShift]
table.summary: The table contains values of the various manual nu shifts for runs
table.remarks: In the early runs the telescope was sometimes not tracking correctly. The boundaries of some of the runs had thus to be shifted by a small amount, determined by hand. This table contains these manual corrections. These should be applied to the nu values derived for these runs. Only those runs are here, for which such a correction needs to be applied.

column.name: [run]
column.summary: Run id

column.name: [shift]
column.summary: The nu shift applied

table.name: [dbo].[sdssSector]
table.summary: Stores the information about set of unique Sector regions
table.remarks: A Sector is defined as a distinct intersection of tiles and TilingGeometries, characterized by a unique combination of intersecting tiles and a list of tilingVersions. The sampling rate for any targets is unambgously defined by the number of tiles involved (nTiles) and the combination of targetVersion.

column.name: [nTiles]

table.remarks: Each 'tile' corresponds to an SDSS-I or -II spectroscopic observation. The tile covers a region of the 1.49 deg in radius, and corresponds to one or more observed plates. At the time the tile was created, all of the 'tiled target' categories (galaxies, quasars, and some very special categories of star) were assigned fibers; later other targets were assigned fibers on the plate.

table.name: [dbo].[segueTargetAll]
table.summary: SEGUE-1 and SEGUE-2 target selection run on all imaging data
table.remarks: This table gives the results for SEGUE target selection algorithms for the full photometric catalog. The target flags in these files are not the ones actually used for the SEGUE-1 and SEGUE-2 survey. Instead, they are derived from the final photometric data set from DR8. Only objects designated RUN_PRIMARY have target selection flags set.

column.name: [objid]
column.summary: unique id, points to photoObj

column.name: [segue1_target1]
column.summary: SEGUE-1 primary target selection flag

column.name: [segue1_target2]
column.summary: SEGUE-1 secondary target selection flag

column.name: [segue2_target1]
column.summary: SEGUE-2 primary target selection flag

column.name: [segue2_target2]
column.summary: SEGUE-2 secondary target selection flag

column.name: [lcolor]
column.summary: SEGUE-1 and -2 target selection color: -0.436*uMag+1.129*gMag-0.119*rMag-0.574*iMag+0.1984 (Lenz et al.1998)

column.name: [scolor]
column.summary: SEGUE-1 target selection color: -0.249*uMag+0.794*gMag-0.555*rMag+0.234+0.011*p1s-0.010 (Helmi et al. 2003)

column.name: [p1s]
column.summary: SEGUE-1 target selection color: 0.91*umg+0.415*umg-1.280 (Helmi et al. 2003)

column.name: [totalpm]
column.summary: sqrt(PMRA*PMRA+PMDEC*PMDEC), in mas/year

column.name: [hg]
column.summary: reduced proper motion, gMag+5*log10(TOTALPM/1000)+5

column.name: [Mi]
column.summary: 4.471+7.907*imz-0.837*imz*imz used in SEGUE-1 target selection, unused in SEGUE-2

column.name: [disti]
column.summary: 10^((iMag-Mi+5)/5.0) used in SEGUE-1 target selection, unused in SEGUE-2

column.name: [Hr]
column.summary: reduced pm (uncorr r): PSFMAG_r+5*log10(TOTALPM/1000)+5

column.name: [vmi_trans1]
column.summary: V-I from VMAG_TRANS-(iMag-0.337*rmi-0.37)

column.name: [vmi_trans2]
column.summary: V-I from 0.877*gmr+0.358

column.name: [vmag_trans]
column.summary: V mag from gMag - 0.587*gmr -0.011

column.name: [distv_kpc]
column.summary: 10^(dmV/5.-2.) where VMAG_TRANS-(3.37*VMI_TRANS1+2.89)

column.name: [vtrans_galrest]
column.summary: transverse velocity, km/s, derived from TOTALPM and DISTV_KPC, in a frame at rest w.r.t the Galaxy

column.name: [mutrans_galradrest]
column.summary: derived PM (mas/year) perpendicular to the Galactocentric radial vector, assuming all motion is along a Galactocentric radial vector, in a frame at rest w.r.t the Galaxy

column.name: [murad_galradrest]
column.summary: derived PM (mas/year) along the Galactocentric radial vector, assuming all motion is along a Galactocentric radial vector, in a frame at rest w.r.t the Galaxy

column.name: [vtot_galradrest]
column.summary: total velocity, km/s, derived from TOTALPM and DISTV_KPC, in a frame at rest w.r.t the Galaxy

column.name: [vtrans_tohv]
column.summary: transverse velocity in Galactocentric coords, using the distance estimate from MG_TOHV which is appropriate for old stars near the MSTO and corrected for peculiar solar motion 16.6 km/s toward RA,Dec 267.5,28.1

column.name: [pm1sigma_tohv]
column.summary: Estimate of the 1-sigma error in total proper motion at this r magnitude. Formula is sqrt(4.56*4.56 + frate*2.30*2.30), where frate is 10^(0.4*(rMag-19.5)). The constants come from the Munn et al. 2004 (AJ, 127, 3034) paper describing the recalibration of USNOB with SDSS.

column.name: [v1sigmaerr_tohv]
column.summary: The corresponding 1-sigma error in the transverse velocity based on PM1SIGMA_TOHV and the the distance estimate using MG_TOHV

table.name: [dbo].[SpecObjAll]
table.summary: Contains the measured parameters for a spectrum.
table.remarks: This is a base table containing ALL the spectroscopic information, including a lot of duplicate and bad data. Use the SpecObj view instead, which has the data properly filtered for cleanliness. These tables contain both the BOSS and SDSS spectrograph data. NOTE: The RA and Dec in this table refer to the DR8 coordinates, which have errors in the region north of 41 deg in Dec. This change does not affect the matching to the photometric catalog.

table.name: [dbo].[sppLines]
table.summary: Contains outputs from the SEGUE Stellar Parameter Pipeline (SSPP).
table.remarks: Spectra for over 500,000 Galactic stars of all common spectral types are available with DR8. These Spectra were processed with a pipeline called the SEGUE Stellar Parameter Pipeline (SSPP, Lee et al. 2008) that computes line indices for a wide range of common features at the radial velocity of the star in question. Note that the line indices for TiO5, TiO8, CaH1, CaH2, and CaH3 are calculated following the prescription given by the Hammer program (Covey et al. 2007). UVCN and BLCN line indices are computed by he equations given in Smith & Norris (1982), and FeI_4 and FeI_5 indices by the recipe in Friel (1987). FeI_1, FeI_2, FeI_3, and SrII line indices are only computed from the local continuum. Thus, these line indices calculated from different methods report the same values for both the local continuum and the global continuum. These outputs are stored in this table, and indexed on the specObjID key index parameter for queries joining to other tables such as specobjall and photoobjall. See the Sample Queries in SkyServer for examples of such queries.

table.name: [dbo].[sppParams]
table.summary: Contains outputs from the SEGUE Stellar Parameter Pipeline (SSPP).
table.remarks: Spectra for over 500,000 Galactic stars of all common spectral types are available with DR8. These Spectra were processed with a pipeline called the SEGUE Stellar Parameter Pipeline' (SSPP, Lee et al. 2008) that computes standard stellar atmospheric parameters such as [Fe/H], log g and Teff for each star by a variety of methods. These outputs are stored in this table, and indexed on the specObjID' key index parameter for queries joining to other tables such as specobjall and photoobjall. bestobjid is also added (and indexed?) Note that all values of -9999 indicate missing or no values. See the Sample Queries in SkyServer for examples of such queries.

table.name: [dbo].[sppTargets]
table.summary: Derived quantities calculated by the SEGUE-2 target selection pipeline.
table.remarks:
There are one of these files per plate. The file has one HDU. That HDU has one row for every object in photoObjAll that is classified as a star inside a 94.4 arcmin radius of the center of the plate. The data for each object are elements of the photoObjAll, specObjAll, sppPrams and propermotions tables taken unaltered from the CAS and derived quantities calculated by the segue-2 target selection code. Appended to the end are the two target selection bitmasks, segue2_target1 and segue2_target2, as set by the target selection code.

Columns from OBJID through PSFMAGERR_:
These are taken directly from photoObjAll

Columns from PLATEID through SEGUE2_TARGET2:
These are taken from the specObjAll and sppParams tables for any objects in this file that have matches in that specObjAll. For objects without matches in specObjAll, values are set to -9999. The names from SpecObjAll are unchanged.

Columns from MATCH through DIST20:
These are taken from the propermotions table, the USNOB proper motions as recalibrated with the SDSS by Jeff Munn. For objects without matches in the ProperMotions table, values are set to -9999. The names are unchanged from the propermotions table.

Columns from uMAG0 through VTOT_GALRADREST:
These are the derived quanitites calculated by the procedure calderivedquantities in derivedquant.pro in the segue-2 target selection code. With the addition of these, this file contains all the quanitites that the selection code operates on when choosing targets.

Columns MG_TOHV through V1SIGMAERR_TOHV:
These were added for the November 2008 drilling run and after. The earlier files will be retrofit (eventually).

column.summary: reduced pm (uncorr r): PSFMAG_r+5*log10(TOTALPM/1000)+5

column.name: [VMI_TRANS1]
column.summary: V-I from VMAG_TRANS-(iMag-0.337*rmi-0.37)

column.name: [VMI_TRANS2]
column.summary: V-I from 0.877*gmr+0.358

column.name: [VMAG_TRANS]
column.summary: V mag from gMag - 0.587*gmr -0.011

column.name: [MV_TRANS]
column.summary: not stuffed

column.name: [DISTV_KPC]
column.summary: 10^(dmV/5.-2.) where VMAG_TRANS-(3.37*VMI_TRANS1+2.89)

column.name: [VTRANS_GALREST]
column.summary: transverse velocity, km/s, derived from TOTALPM and DISTV_KPC, in a frame at rest w.r.t the Galaxy

column.name: [MUTRANS_GALRADREST]
column.summary: derived PM (mas/year) perpendicular to the Galactocentric radial vector, assuming all motion is along a Galactocentric radial vector, in a frame at rest w.r.t the Galaxy

column.name: [MURAD_GALRADREST]
column.summary: derived PM (mas/year) along the Galactocentric radial vector, assuming all motion is along a Galactocentric radial vector, in a frame at rest w.r.t the Galaxy

column.name: [VTOT_GALRADREST]
column.summary: total velocioty, km/s, derived from TOTALPM and DISTV_KPC, in a frame at rest w.r.t the Galaxy

column.name: [VTRANS_TOHV]
column.summary: transverse velocity in Galactocentric coords, using the distance estimate from MG_TOHV which is appropriate for old stars near the MSTO and corrected for peculiar solar motion 16.6 km/s toward RA,Dec 267.5,28.1

column.name: [PM1SIGMA_TOHV]
column.summary: Estimate of the 1-sigma error in total proper motion at this r magnitude. Formula is sqrt(4.56*4.56 + frate*2.30*2.30), where frate is 10^(0.4*(rMag-19.5)). The constants come from the Munn et al. 2004 (AJ, 127, 3034) paper describing the recalibration of USNOB with SDSS.

column.name: [V1SIGMAERR_TOHV]
column.summary: The corresponding 1-sigma error in the transverse velocity based on PM1SIGMA_TOHV and the the distance estimate using MG_TOHV

column.name: [TARGET_VERSION]
column.summary: version of target used

table.name: [dbo].[stellarMassFSPSGranEarlyDust]
table.summary: Estimated stellar masses for SDSS and BOSS galaxies (Granada method, early-star-formation with dust)
table.remarks: Stellar masses using FSPS models of Conroy et al. (2009) fit to SDSS photometry in ugriz. The fit is carried out on extinction corrected model magnitudes that are scaled to the i-band c-model magnitude. This 'early-star-formation' version restricts the assumption about when the star-formation in the galaxy could occur to within 2 Gyrs of the Big Bang. This version also fits for dust extinction.

table.name: [dbo].[stellarMassFSPSGranWideNoDust]
table.summary: Estimated stellar masses for SDSS and BOSS galaxies (Granada method, early-star-formation with dust)
table.remarks: Stellar masses using FSPS models of Conroy et al. (2009) fit to SDSS photometry in ugriz. The fit is carried out on extinction corrected model magnitudes that are scaled to the i-band c-model magnitude. This 'wide-star-formation' version allows an extended star-formation history. This version assumes no dust extinction.

table.name: [dbo].[stellarMassPassivePort]
table.summary: Estimated stellar masses for SDSS and BOSS galaxies (Portsmouth method, passive model)
table.remarks: Stellar masses using the method of Maraston et al. (2009). These fit passive stellar evolution models to the SDSS photometry, using the known redshifts. The model is a instantaneous burst stellar population whose age is fit for (with a minimum allowed age of 3 Gyrs). The population is 97% solar metallicity and 3% metal-poor, by mass. In this table we assume the Kroupa IMF.

table.name: [dbo].[stellarMassPCAWiscBC03]
table.summary: Estimated stellar masses for SDSS and BOSS galaxies (Wisconsin method, Bruzual-Charlot models)
table.remarks: Stellar masses using the method of Chen et al. (2012). In this table, the best estimate of stellar mass is 'mstellar_median'. This version of the table uses the Bruzual and Charlot (2003) stellar population synthesis models. Please use the 'warning' values to check for data quality: warning = 0 : Results correspond to a best-fit PCA spectrum (no problems detected) warning = 1 : Target redshift too small (z < 0.05) warning = 2 : Target redshift too large (z > 0.80) warning = 3 : READSPEC cannot get wavelength vector warning = 4 : Available wavelengths all outside PCA coverage warning = 5 : Unable to project projection wavelength range warning = 6 : Unable to select projection wavelength range warning = 7 : Minimum chi^2 less than zero warning = 8 : Total of log mass PDF equal to zero warning = 9 : Total of velocity dispersion PDF equal to zero

table.name: [dbo].[stellarMassStarformingPort]
table.summary: Estimated stellar masses for SDSS and BOSS galaxies (Portsmouth method, star-forming model).
table.remarks: Stellar masses using the method of Maraston et al. (2006). These fit stellar evolution models to the SDSS photometry, using the known BOSS redshifts. The star-formation model uses a metallicity (specified in the 'metallicity' column) and one of three star-formation histories: constant, truncated, and exponentially declining ('tau'). The type, and relevant time scale, are given in the 'SFH' column. The 'age' listed gives the start time for the onset of star-formation in each model. In this table we assume the Kroupa IMF.

column.name: [specObjID]
column.summary: Unique ID

column.name: [plate]
column.summary: Plate number

column.name: [fiberID]
column.summary: Fiber ID

column.name: [mjd]
column.summary: MJD of observation

column.name: [ra]
column.summary: Right ascension of fiber, J2000

column.name: [dec]
column.summary: Declination of fiber, J2000

column.name: [z]
column.summary: Redshift used (corresponds to z_noqso in specObjAll)

column.name: [zErr]
column.summary: Error in z (corresponds to zErr_noqso in specObjAll)

column.name: [logMass]
column.summary: Best-fit stellar mass of galaxy

column.name: [minLogMass]
column.summary: 1-sigma minimum stellar mass (where chi-squared is within minimum + 1)

column.name: [maxLogMass]
column.summary: 1-sigma maximum stellar mass (where chi-squared is within minimum + 1)

column.name: [medianPDF]
column.summary: Median value in mass PDF (log base 10 in solar masses)

column.name: [PDF16]
column.summary: 16% lower limit on stellar mass in PDF

column.name: [PDF84]
column.summary: 84% upper limit on stellar mass in PDF

column.name: [peakPDF]
column.summary: Peak of PDF (log base 10 in solar masses)

column.name: [minLogMass_noMassLoss]

column.name: [PDF16_noMassLoss]

column.name: [PDF84_noMassLoss]

column.name: [peakPDF_noMassLoss]

column.name: [reducedChi2]
column.summary: Reduced chi squared of best fit

column.name: [age]
column.summary: Age of best fit

column.name: [minAge]
column.summary: 1-sigma minimum age (where chi-squared is within minimum + 1)

column.name: [maxAge]
column.summary: 1-sigma maximum age (where chi-squared is within minimum + 1)

column.name: [SFR]
column.summary: Star-formation rate of best fit

column.name: [minSFR]

column.name: [maxSFR]

column.name: [absMagK]
column.summary: Absolute magnitude in K inferred from model

column.name: [SFH]
column.summary: Star-formation history model used ("const" or "tau=X" or "trunc=X", where X is the exponential decline rate, or the time until truncation of the model)

column.name: [Metallicity]

column.name: [reddeninglaw]

column.name: [nFilter]

table.name: [dbo].[StripeDefs]
table.summary: This table contains the definitions of the survey layout as planned
table.remarks: The lower and upper limits of the actual stripes may differ from these values. The actual numbers are found in the Segment and Chunk tables.

column.name: [stripe]
column.summary: Stripe number

column.name: [hemisphere]
column.summary: Which hemisphere (N|S)

column.name: [eta]
column.summary: Survey eta for the center of stripe

column.name: [lambdaMin]
column.summary: Survey lambda lower limit of the stripe

column.name: [lambdaMax]
column.summary: Survey lambda upper limit of the stripe

column.name: [htmArea]
column.summary: HTM area descriptor string

table.name: [dbo].[thingIndex]
table.summary: Full list of all 'things': unique objects in the SDSS imaging
table.remarks: Each row in this table corresponds to a single 'thing' observed by the SDSS imaging survey. By joining with the 'detectionIndex' table one can retrieve all of the observations of a particular thing. NOTE: The RA and Dec in this table refer to the DR8 coordinates, which have errors in the region north of 41 deg in Dec, since those were used for the resolving of the survey. These errors should have a very small effect on the decision about which objects are matched to each other.

column.name: [thingId]
column.summary: thing ID number

column.name: [sdssPolygonID]
column.summary: id number of polygon containing object in sdssPolygons

column.name: [fieldID]
column.summary: field identification of primary field

column.name: [objID]
column.summary: id of object for primary (or best) observation

column.name: [isPrimary]
column.summary: Non-zero if there is a detection of this object in the primary field covering this balkan.

column.name: [nDetect]
column.summary: Number of detections of this object.

column.name: [nEdge]
column.summary: Number of fields in which this is a RUN_EDGE object (observation close to edge)

column.name: [ra]
column.summary: DR8 Right ascension, J2000 deg

column.name: [dec]
column.summary: DR8 Declination, J2000 deg

column.name: [loadVersion]
column.summary: Load Version

table.name: [dbo].[zoo2MainPhotoz]
table.summary: Description: Morphological classifications of main-sample galaxies with photometric redshifts only from Galaxy Zoo 2
table.remarks: This table includes galaxies without spectra in SDSS Data Release 7. Several columns give data that can be used to cross-match rows with other SDSS tables, including objIDs and positions of the galaxies. Morphological classifications include six parameters for each category: unweighted and weighted versions of both the total number of votes and the vote fraction for that response, the vote fraction after being debiased, and flags for systems identified as being in clean samples. Reference: The project and data release are described in Willett et al. (2013, in prep). Please cite this paper if making use of any data in this table in publications.

column.name: [dr7objid]

column.summary: declination [J2000.0], decimal degrees

column.summary: right ascension [J2000.0], sexagesimal

column.name: [decstring]
column.summary: declination [J2000.0], sexagesimal
