table.name: [dbo].[zoo2MainSpecz]
table.summary: Morphological classifications of main-sample spectroscopic galaxies from Galaxy Zoo 2.
table.remarks: This table includes galaxies with spectra in SDSS Data Release 7. Several columns give data that can be used to cross-match rows with other SDSS tables, including objIDs and positions of the galaxies. Morphological classifications include six parameters for each category: unweighted and weighted versions of both the total number of votes and the vote fraction for that response, the vote fraction after being debiased, and flags for systems identified as being in clean samples. Note that this table and zoo2Stripe82Normal contain some of the same galaxies (with r < 17.0). Reference: The project and data release are described in Willett et al. (2013, in prep). Please cite this paper if making use of any data in this table in publications.

column.summary: obj ID

column.name: [dr8objid]
column.summary: match to the DR8 objID

column.name: [dr7objid]
column.summary: match to the DR7 objID

column.name: [ra]
column.summary: right ascension [J2000.0], decimal degrees

column.name: [dec]
column.summary: declination [J2000.0], decimal degrees

column.name: [rastring]
column.summary: right ascension [J2000.0], sexagesimal

column.name: [decstring]
column.summary: declination [J2000.0], sexagesimal

column.name: [sample]
column.summary: sub-sample identification

column.name: [total_classifications]

column.name: [total_votes]
column.summary: total number of votes for each response, summed over all classifications

table.name: [dbo].[zoo2Stripe82Coadd1]
table.summary: Morphological classifications of Stripe 82, coadded (sample 1) spectroscopic galaxies from Galaxy Zoo 2
table.remarks: This table includes classifications from coadded images of Stripe 82 galaxies in SDSS Data Release 7. The co-addition method is described in Willett et al.; it differs from the second sample in that these images did NOT desaturate color in their noisy background pixels. Several columns give data that can be used to cross-match rows with other SDSS tables, including objIDs and positions of the galaxies. Morphological classifications include six parameters for each category: unweighted and weighted versions of both the total number of votes and the vote fraction for that response, the vote fraction after being debiased, and flags for systems identified as being in clean samples. Reference: The project and data release are described in Willett et al. (2013, in prep). Please cite this paper if making use of any data in this table in publications.

column.name: [specobjid]
column.summary: obj ID

column.name: [stripe82objid]
column.summary: objID of the galaxy in the Stripe82 context of CasJobs

column.name: [dr8objid]
column.summary: match to the DR8 objID for the corresponding normal-depth image

column.name: [dr7objid]
column.summary: match to the DR7 objID

column.name: [ra]
column.summary: right ascension [J2000.0], decimal degrees

column.name: [dec]
column.summary: declination [J2000.0], decimal degrees

column.name: [rastring]
column.summary: right ascension [J2000.0], sexagesimal

column.name: [decstring]
column.summary: declination [J2000.0], sexagesimal

column.name: [sample]
column.summary: sub-sample identification

column.name: [total_classifications]
column.summary: total number of classifications for this galaxy

column.name: [total_votes]
column.summary: total number of votes for each response, summed over all classifications

table.name: [dbo].[zoo2Stripe82Coadd2]
table.summary: Morphological classifications of Stripe 82, coadded (sample 2) spectroscopic galaxies from Galaxy Zoo 2
table.remarks: This table includes classifications from coadded images of Stripe 82 galaxies in SDSS Data Release 7. Sky background pixels for these co-added images were desaturated to attempt and avoid bias by classifiers, as described in Willett et al. Several columns give data that can be used to cross-match rows with other SDSS tables, including objIDs and positions of the galaxies. Morphological classifications include six parameters for each category: unweighted and weighted versions of both the total number of votes and the vote fraction for that response, the vote fraction after being debiased, and flags for systems identified as being in clean samples. Reference: The project and data release are described in Willett et al. (2013, in prep). Please cite this paper if making use of any data in this table in publications.

column.name: [specobjid]
column.summary: obj ID

column.name: [stripe82objid]
column.summary: objID of the galaxy in the Stripe82 context of CasJobs

column.name: [dr8objid]
column.summary: match to the DR8 objID for the corresponding normal-depth image

column.name: [dr7objid]
column.summary: match to the DR7 objID

column.name: [ra]
column.summary: right ascension [J2000.0], decimal degrees

column.name: [dec]
column.summary: declination [J2000.0], decimal degrees

column.name: [rastring]
column.summary: right ascension [J2000.0], sexagesimal

column.name: [decstring]
column.summary: declination [J2000.0], sexagesimal

column.name: [sample]
column.summary: sub-sample identification

column.name: [total_classifications]
column.summary: total number of classifications for this galaxy

column.name: [total_votes]
column.summary: total number of votes for each response, summed over all classifications

table.name: [dbo].[zoo2Stripe82Normal]
table.summary: Morphological classifications of Stripe 82 normal-depth, spectroscopic galaxies from Galaxy Zoo 2
table.remarks: This table includes Stripe 82 galaxies with spectra in SDSS Data Release 7. Several columns give data that can be used to cross-match rows with other SDSS tables, including objIDs and positions of the galaxies. Morphological classifications include six parameters for each category: unweighted and weighted versions of both the total number of votes and the vote fraction for that response, the vote fraction after being debiased, and flags for systems identified as being in clean samples. Note that this table and zoo2MainSpecz contain some of the same galaxies (with r < 17.0). Reference: The project and data release are described in Willett et al. (2013, in prep). Please cite this paper if making use of any data in this table in publications.

column.name: [specobjid]
column.summary: obj ID

column.name: [dr8objid]
column.summary: match to the DR8 objID for the corresponding normal-depth image

column.name: [dr7objid]
column.summary: match to the DR7 objID

column.name: [ra]
column.summary: right ascension [J2000.0], decimal degrees

column.name: [dec]
column.summary: declination [J2000.0], decimal degrees

column.name: [rastring]
column.summary: right ascension [J2000.0], sexagesimal

column.name: [decstring]
column.summary: declination [J2000.0], sexagesimal

column.name: [sample]
column.summary: sub-sample identification

column.name: [total_classifications]
column.summary: total number of classifications for this galaxy

column.name: [total_votes]
column.summary: total number of votes for each response, summed over all classifications

table.name: [dbo].[zooConfidence]
table.summary: Measures of classification confidence from Galaxy Zoo.
table.remarks: Only galaxies with spectra in DR7 are included (those in the zooSpec table). This information is identical to that in Galaxy Zoo 1 Table 4. The project is described in Lintott et al., 2008, MNRAS, 389, 1179 and the data release is described in Lintott et al. 2010. Anyone making use of the data should cite at least one of these papers in any resulting publications.

column.name: [specobjid]
column.summary: match to DR8 spectrum object

column.name: [objid]
column.summary: DR8 ObjID

column.name: [dr7objid]
column.summary: DR7 ObjID

column.name: [ra]
column.summary: Right Ascension, J2000 deg

column.name: [dec]
column.summary: Declination, J2000 deg

column.name: [rastring]
column.summary: Right ascension in sexagesimal

column.name: [decstring]
column.summary: Declination in sexagesimal

column.name: [f_unclass_clean]
column.summary: fraction of galaxies in same bin that are unclassified, clean condition

column.name: [f_misclass_clean]
column.summary: fraction of galaxies in same bin that are misclassified, clean condition

column.name: [avcorr_clean]
column.summary: average bias correction in bin, clean condition

column.name: [stdcorr_clean]
column.summary: std dev of bias corrections in bin, clean condition

column.name: [f_misclass_greater]
column.summary: fraction of galaxies in same bin that are misclassified, greater condition

column.name: [avcorr_greater]
column.summary: average bias correction in bin, greater condition

column.name: [stdcorr_greater]
column.summary: std dev of bias corrections in bin, greater condition

table.name: [dbo].[zooMirrorBias]
table.summary: Results from the bias study using mirrored images from Galaxy Zoo
table.remarks: This information is identical to that in Galaxy Zoo 1 Table 5. The project is described in Lintott et al., 2008, MNRAS, 389, 1179 and the data release is described in Lintott et al. 2010. Anyone making use of the data should cite at least one of these papers in any resulting publications.

table.name: [dbo].[zooNoSpec]
table.summary: Morphology classifications of galaxies without spectra from Galaxy Zoo
table.remarks: This information is identical to that in Galaxy Zoo 1 Table 3. Some objects may have spectroscopic matches in DR8 (though they did not in DR7) It is not possible to estimate the bias in the sample, and so only the fraction of the vote in each of the six categories is given. The project is described in Lintott et al., 2008, MNRAS, 389, 1179 and the data release is described in Lintott et al. 2010. Anyone making use of the data should cite at least one of these papers in any resulting publications.

table.name: [dbo].[zooSpec]
table.summary: Morphological classifications of spectroscopic galaxies from Galaxy Zoo
table.remarks: This information is identical to that in Galaxy Zoo 1 Table 2. This table includes galaxies with spectra in SDSS Data Release 7. The fraction of the vote in each of the six categories is given, along with debiased votes in elliptical and spiral categories and flags identifying systems as classified as spiral, elliptical or uncertain. The project is described in Lintott et al., 2008, MNRAS, 389, 1179 and the data release is described in Lintott et al. 2010. Anyone making use of the data should cite at least one of these papers in any resulting publications.

The project is described in Lintott et al., 2008, MNRAS, 389, 1179 and the data release is described in Lintott et al. 2010. Anyone making use of the data should cite at least one of these papers in any resulting publications.
